column4: also on a side note, a minute ago I logged into failsafe gnome...now I can't select my normal login
how can I tell what the fs is?
wiseshund: and tecna: is there a linux command /term command to discover what the filesystem is?
/etc/sudoers is mode 0666, should be 0440 wiseshund: prof0ak: and tecna:
so what in the heck can I do...I NEED to backup these files really bad
the first thing you must do is backup .. now
it will dump the erraneous device to a file
there must be space on the target device to fit of cause
that will make a raw dump of what you got right now
Again I cannot stress the most imporant thing to do when a drive fails - get the data of the drive and put it somewhere else
